DOC.detailed_description: The investigator conduct Stage 1 pilot feasibility study McLean Hospital develop medication treat nicotine dependence . In randomized , double-blind , placebo-controlled trial , 40 nicotine-dependent participant age 18-65 receive cognitive behavioral therapy ( CBT ) nicotine replacement therapy ( NRT ) 10- week period , half receive D-cycloserine ( DCS ) pretreatment half receive placebo . Participants receive either 250 mg DCS placebo prior weekly CBT session addition NRT 10-week treatment period . The investigator also aim determine effect DCS performance neuropsychological test . A 10-week treatment period follow follow-up assessment include neuropsychological test 1 3 month post-treatment . Primary outcome include smoke measure carbon monoxide level self-report measurement .
